body:
@adg: I thought the argument made by Dmitri for why `select { case c <- true: }` might be legitimate [on go-nuts](https://groups.google.com/d/msg/golang-nuts/cHE5m_p9fS8/_HWEuqACBmUJ) was quite good. It certainly convinced me that making this a **build** error would be a bad idea. I do think it's sensible for `go vet` to complain about it though.

For `for {}`, the case doesn't seem as clear-cut, as this is a sensible construct for application with an actually infinite main event/dispatch loop, loops with multiple exit conditions where exit condition enumeration might make it clearer what's going on, and for loops with dynamic exit conditions.
